intro: Alyssum heldreichii var. astrotrichocarpum, commonly known as the Balkan alyssum, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or white, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or limestone habitats.
